metadata.title: CVE-2023-22466 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: Tokio is a runtime for writing applications with Rust. Starting withversion 1.7.0 and prior to versions 1.18.4, 1.20.3, and 1.23.1, whenconfiguring a Windows named pipe server, setting `pipe_mode` will reset`reject_remote_clients` to `false`. If the application has previouslyconfigured `reject_remote_clients` to `true`, this effectively undoes theconfiguration. Remote clients may only access the named pipe if the namedpipe's associated path is accessible via a publicly shared folder (SMB).Versions 1.23.1, 1.20.3, and 1.18.4 have been patched. The fix will also bepresent in all releases starting from version 1.24.0. Named pipes wereintroduced to Tokio in version 1.7.0, so releases older than 1.7.0 are notaffected. As a workaround, ensure that `pipe_mode` is set first afterinitializing a `ServerOptions`.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
mozjs38 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
rustc package in bionic is affected and needs fixing.
